TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TableHeaderCell extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell

Docs.summary: Represents a heading cell within a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> class represents a heading cell in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Text%2A> property to specify or determine the contents of the heading cell.
This class allows you to control how the contents of the heading cell are displayed. The alignment of the contents in the heading cell is specified by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.HorizontalAlign%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.VerticalAlign%2A> properties. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.Wrap%2A> property to specify whether the contents of the heading cell wrap in the cell.
You can also specify how many rows or columns in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Table> control are occupied by an individual heading cell. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.RowSpan%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.ColumnSpan%2A> properties control how may rows and columns are used, respectively.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to declaratively program a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> control.

## Examples The following example demonstrates how to programmatically add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> control to a Web page. For a complete, working code example, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow> class overview topic.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string AbbreviatedText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attribute of the HTML element for the control.
Docs.value: A string representing the abbreviated text. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> property is rendered as the `abbr` attribute of the HTML `th` element. The `abbr` attribute is used by screen readers to read a shortened version of a header for each cell in the table. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> property is significant for browsers that render abbreviated text in place of the content for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> control.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to program the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> property declaratively.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void AddAttributesToRender(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: An that receives the rendered content.
Docs.summary: Applies attributes to render to the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.AddAttributesToRender%2A> method for the base class and, in addition to calling the base method, renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.Scope%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.AbbreviatedText%2A> properties to the `scope` and `abbr` attribute of HTML `th` element, respectively.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string[] CategoryText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the attribute of the HTML element for the control.
Docs.value: An array of string values representing the categories.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The categories can be any string values that are pertinent to the table. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.CategoryText%2A> property is rendered as the `axis` attribute of the HTML `th` element, which is used to group table cells into conceptual categories. The categories are rendered in HTML as a comma-delimited list.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to program the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.CategoryText%2A> property declaratively.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the control when it is rendered.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.Scope%2A> property to get or set the scope of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> control when it is rendered. The scope of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell> represents the cells that the header applies to. For complex tables, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property, which provides more control over the specification of the relationship of header cells to data cells. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.Scope%2A> property is used to make HTML tables more accessible by providing information about relationships between the cells and the headers.
For a list of the available table header scopes, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderScope>.
The value of this property is stored in view state.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to program the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableHeaderCell.Scope%2A> property declaratively. Note the use of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableCell.AssociatedHeaderCellID%2A> property.
